fields.description:

As an anonymous user, open the macro browser and select the 'Network' macro.

This message is displayed:
{noformat}The content of this macro can only be viewed by users who have logged in. {noformat}

This is not correct, as the content of the macro can be viewed by an anonymous user.

fields.description:
following scenario:
We have a high amount of dynamictasklist macros with many content rows (defined tasks). After the update to confluence 2.10.3 all macros with a "." sign in the title (e.g. "Auswertung Backup 05.09") the new dynamictasklist macro kept empty (showed no lines any more). Only the macros without the "." in the title showed up the old content.

I guess this is a bug!?

Would it be also possible to use the *old* dynamictasklist macro from version 2.7 in the new confluence version (2.10.3) because we need further more the feature that the user-name of the person checking the task will be shown right beside the task. The old design was more clean for us!


(Unfortunately we had to perform a roll-back from confluence version 2.10.3 back to 2.7 due to this issue with the dynamictasklist macro)
fields.summary: dynamictasklist macro didn't display old content after confluence-update

fields.description:
Images that have been edited using Word (ie. adding text, shapes, etc) do not import correctly into Confluence. The original image will import, however any edits do not get carried over.

This occurs using both {viewfile} macro and Doc Import.

fields.description:
Images in Word documents are automatically resized when importing to Confluence, to the point that any text is unreadable.

This only affects documents that are imported using Doc Import. Using the {{viewfile}} macro renders images correctly.
fields.summary: Images in Word documents resized on doc import

fields.description:
The problem is that we submit a reindex task per cluster node to the ClusteredTaskQueue. But tasks in that queue can be run by any node and they will only run on one node. So whichever node first picks up the task will run it, which is most likely not the node that submitted the task. If the task is picked up by a node which currently is reindexing it will just be ignored, so in most cases you end up with at least one node not being reindexed.
This is an architectural problem and we need to use some kind of local task queue for reindexing tasks.
fields.summary: RebuildIndexUpgradeTask only runs on one cluster node

fields.description:
1.) The "Recently Updated" portlet on the dashboard stops updating.

2.) We manually restart Content Indexing through Administration. This first doesnt seem to work, then we notice the "Queue Contents" are also full, with Number of items in queue: 283
 
3.) We try to click "Flush Queue"

4.) A minute later the "Recently updated" portlet has updated again, and it seems to be fixed, but the queue is not empty or changing

5.) We are not 100% sure what fixed it now, probably Content Indexing did but there was a delay

6.) We still think it cant be right that the queue is not processing stuff anymore, even though users dont seem to notice problems yet (anymore)

7.) This has happened before, and was fixed by restarting the complete server, which we had to do anyways to insert more RAM., but that was just a conincidence, and we dont want to restart this procduction system every time this happens

8.) We have seen http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9871?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Aall-tabpanel with similar problems, but we dont have those plugins mentioned there as a cause.

The queue has stopped processing on May 11, 2009 19:50, the "Recently updated" had stopped working on May 12, after we re-indexed it is up to date again, but not the queue.

fields.description:
Confluence produces a stacktrace error com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException  when we display a big png dimension image with align parameter. In order to reproduce the problem, please go through the following steps:
# Create a page containing the following:
{noformat}
h1. !RAP-Configuration-ERM.png|align=center!
{noformat}
# Save it
# Export the page to PDF.

If you, either remove {{align=center}} or h1, the export function will be working fine. The following is the stacktrace that happens after exporting the page to PDF.
{noformat}
 com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'exportWikiToXslFo' in class com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter threw exception com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiRenderException: Error while generating XSL-FO for 'EAIPROJECTS:Configuration Database' @ com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.pdfexport.vm[20,37]
    at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter.generateXslFo(PdfExporter.java:165)

caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'exportWikiToXslFo' in class com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter threw exception com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiRenderException: Error while generating XSL-FO for 'EAIPROJECTS:Configuration Database' @ com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.pdfexport.vm[20,37]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:286)

caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiRenderException: Error while generating XSL-FO for 'EAIPROJECTS:Configuration Database'
    at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.exportWikiToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:106)

caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.WikiRenderException: Can not transform XHTML to XSL-FO due to an error in the following XHTML null
    at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.impl.WikiExporter.convertXHtmlToXslFo(WikiExporter.java:205)

caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.dom4j.io.DOMReader.read(DOMReader.java:86) 
{noformat}

Please note that I have tried the problem using images which type png, jpeg and bmp. Using those types, the problem are reproducible.
fields.summary: Big dimension of image file crashes Confluence when we tries to export the page to PDF.

Since that upgrade, I get an error when I display jira issues.

my jira issues request is : 
{code}{jiraissues:url=http://jira.prod.appli-gestion.nc/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?&pid=10084&resolution=-1&component=-1&sorter/field=priority&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1000&os_username=confluence&os_password=confluence|columns=key,summary,status,assignee} {code}

I already tryed different work arounds with the same result :

Any idea ?
Thanks
Math

fields.description: Atlassian-pdk expects that the {{uploadplugin}} action redirects to {{plugins action}}. In order not to break the atlassian-pdk we needed to keep redirecting to an xsrf protected {{plugins.action}} instead of {{viewplugins.action}}. We need to fix it once the new version of atlassian-pdk is released.
fields.summary: change uploadpluin action to redirect to viewplugins.action on success

fields.description:
On a number of occasions, upgrading Extranet has triggered some kind of bug that has caused the global settings to be reset to their default values. The most obvious cause of this is that some piece of code has created a new Settings() object and saved it through the settings manager.

One way to prevent this from happening would be to make it impossible to save a Settings object that was not first loaded from the settings manager. Have the manager 'tag' each settings object on the way through and refuse to save any that is was not responsible for loading.

Obviously there's one point where it would be necessary to create a new settings object - during initial setup - but that could be taken care of by an explicit method for that purpose.
fields.summary: Prevent global settings from being accidentally overwritten
Did-You-Mean indexing creates a lot of Lucene segments during indexing

fields.description: It interns all words used in the DYM search index, which could be a lot!
fields.summary: Did-you-mean search IncrementalIndexBuilder uses large amount of PermGen memory to store words

fields.description: Remote API and allowing Public Sign Up are enabled by default. It would be more sensible to disable these by default.
fields.summary: Sensible default settings for Remote API and Public Sign Up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15640].
  {panel}

See screenshot.

I am following 30 people. Suppose I want to stop following one of them, from the Network Tab. As the names are not shown, and the pictures are not ordered, I cannot easily find the user I want. This can be difficult - I may not recognise people from their picture, or they may not have a picture, or be using a generic icon.  Therefore I would have to try Hover on each one of the 30 users until I find the one I want.

If I have 31 or more users in my follow list, I get a 'Show All' link - this takes me to an ordered list showing both pictures and names. It easy to find a particular user in this list.

There should be a link provided to this view even when the number of followers is 30 or less.
fields.summary: Include link to "Show All" on followed-users list when you have less than 30

fields.description:
When starting the integration test for my plugin (Newcode macro) using the atlassian PDK , the plugin fails to load due to unresolved dependencies in the OSGi environment. However, when using pluginVersion="1" (or no plugin version, so no OSGi), the exact same error messages show up in the log file, so the problems does not seem to be in my plugin, but in the confluence environment.

Stacktrace in output.log during integration testing:

2009-05-04 22:40:28,348 ERROR [FelixDispatchQueue] [osgi.container.felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager] frameworkEvent Framework error in bundle org.springframework.bundle.osgi.extender
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Unresolved constraint in bundle 2: package; (&(package=org.apache.log4j)(version>=1.2.15)(!(version>=2.0.0)))
    at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._resolveBundle(Felix.java:1725)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix._startBundle(Felix.java:1588)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.startBundle(Felix.java:1541)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.Felix.setFrameworkStartLevel(Felix.java:1135)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.StartLevelImpl.run(StartLevelImpl.java:267)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

Originally reported @ http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Converting+a+Plugin+to+Plugin+Framework+2?focusedCommentId=188514384#comment-188514384

This bug can easily be reproduced using the Newcode macro. Version 1.9.0 is probably the best to test it with, as this is the smallest version, without a lot of extra features.
fields.summary: pluginVersion 2 plugins (OSGi) fail to load due to unresolved dependencies in integration test
Need a better way to close side-profile

fields.description: It would be helpful to add the ability to edit attached office documents (.doc, xls, ppt, etc) directly form the attachments screen/list.  This is similar to the "View" capability where when you view a word document, there is a hidden link that opens the document for editing.  It would be nice if right in the list there is an "Edit in Office" link that opens the document for editing.

fields.description:
Confluence has a problem in displaying the hyperlink when we use image file which type is png. The problem occurs when using Left Navigation theme and IE 7. So that, we can reproduce the problem, please follow the steps below: # Download the attached png file. # Create a page contains the following: {noformat} {html}

Test Mindmap with links

{html} {noformat} Please change the url address ({{http://localhost:8210/download/attachments/5931012/image.png}}) on the above script to be the address of your attached image on your page. # Save the page # Set the space theme to be Left Navigation theme. # Attach the HTML and view the page that you just created in IE 7. # The result, the image wont be able to be clicked where it is supposed to be clickable. I tried the problem on 2.10.3 and it only happens on image which type is png. I have tried to use png, bmp, jpg. Cheers,
fields.summary: hyperlinks image inside tag <area></area> is not clickable while it is supposed to be clickable

See https://qa-cac.atlassian.com/display/CONFEVAL/Hot+Tips

When the page is exported to PDF, the formatting is very messed up - see screenshots.

These page styles are new, and the PDF export is new, and so it would be good if they worked well together.

fields.description:
Upon entering and saving PDF stylesheet changes in the PDF stylesheet component of the new PDF export feature, unnecessary white space is added to the start of the first line (and also appears to be added to the end of the last line too - refer to image with highlighted text).

If the PDF stylesheet is subsequently edited, the white space vanishes from the edit entry boxes until the user saves their changes again.
fields.summary: Unnecessary white space is added to the start and end of PDF stylesheet content upon saving changes.

fields.description:
In Confluence 2.10, we had an osgi-cache directory in the Confluence home directory. As far as I know, this isn't automatically cleaned up when you upgrade to Confluence 3.0.

We should make sure there are no other unused old directories left in the home directory as well.
fields.summary: OSGi plugin cache directory is not cleaned up

fields.description:
The Search page of the wiki looks different on Safari. The advanced search box will go to right (out of sight). With this resolution , like 1280 x 1024, there will be a horizontal scrollbar. When you make the page smaller, then there is no problem.

Please refer to the attachment for more information:
* [^safari.JPG]

*NOTE:* this is tested in Safari 3.2.1and it also affect Google Chrome browser

On the other hand Firefox (3.0.10) and IE7display the results correctly, see the attachment for more information:
* [^IE7.JPG]
* [^firefox 3.0.JPG]

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to Global  Logo via _Administration --> Global Logo_
# Attach a logo (make sure the global logo is turn on)
# Now try to search for a space or page in the search box
fields.summary: Search results page does not flow correctly with Safari when logos are used

fields.description:
If a user (say user1) is in LDAP and another user (say admin) follows that user. Then user1 gets deleted, the admin user will have following 'anonymous' on their profile. When the user1 gets created again, the admin user is then considered already following user1.

The user follow info should be wiped out when user1 is deleted.

This is causing the LDAP build to fail: UserProfileAcceptanceTest.testFollowOnProfile (cause testFollowMacroOnPage() is run first and sets up the exact scenario described above).
fields.summary: Follow info not removed when user is removed with LDAP integration or Crowd

fields.description: We don't test them, hence they're a frequent source of regressions (the most recent being CONF-15588).
fields.summary: Write automated tests for notification emails

fields.description:
!user-email-preferences.jpg!

* The important information (HTML vs TEXT) is not prominent enough and gets lost in the surrounding text.
* The width of the description below the HTML/TEXT heading is a different width to all the descriptions below it
* There is not enough spacing between the HTML/TEXT description and the next checkbox, and the spacing is inconsistent with all the checkboxes below.
fields.summary: New look for user email preferences needs its layout fixed
Record Cache Statistics at the end of each performance test run

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15605].
  {panel}

Hi,

When editing a page and clicking on Insert Link button, a window appears that let you choose between history, recently updated, external links and attachments.

When choosing attachment, the list of attachments in the page appears, but only the last version of each attachment. It would be very useful to show also old versions of an attachment, so that you can insert a link to a specific version of a file.

The only way to proceed now is to go to attachments page and copy the hard link to the old version desired, then modify the page and paste the link as external link.

Thanks for help

(initial question: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-32044)
fields.summary: Display old versions of attachements in Insert Link window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15601].
  {panel}

{{com.benryan.conversion.SlideConversionThread.convertFile}} method takes up to 30% of all runable time. Most of this time is under:
* javax.imageio.ImageIO.write
* com.sun.pdfview.PDFFile.getPage
* com.sun.pdfview.BaseWatchable.run
fields.summary: Experimental performance builds show pdf conversion takes up to 30% of runable time
Updates for user-hover to use inline-dialog

fields.description: We need some documentation for the new boosting strategy extension point created in CONF-15213. It should be added as a plugin module type to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Plugin+Module+Types .
fields.summary: Write documentation for boosting strategy extension point

fields.description:
Go to a page using the Left Nav theme.

Enter text into the quick nav box.

No results are seen - it looks like the menu is there but is hidden behind the page content.
fields.summary: Quick Nav is not working on Left Nav theme

fields.description:
Disable the Profile Macro plugin, or just the network macro.

The Network tab will now display a red error "Unknown macro: {network}" instead of the list of followed people.

The Sidebar in a user's Personal Space will also show this error.

See screenshots.

This doesn't look good. If the network macro has been disabled, then the Network tab and Sidebar should still work using an alternative display method, or they should not try to show the information.

It also may not make sense to allow users to follow/stop following if they can't access the details of who they have followed.
fields.summary: Network tab and Sidebar look rubbish when the Network macro has been disabled

fields.description:
Disable the Profile Macro plugin, or just the profile macro.

Hover Profiles will now display a red error "Unknown macro: {profile}" instead of the user details.

The People Directory will just contain repeated instances of this error.

See screenshots.

This doesn't look good. If the profile macro has been disabled, then Hover and People Directory should still work using an alternative display method, or they should be disabled too.
fields.summary: Hover Profile and People Directory look rubbish when the Profile macro has been disabled

fields.description:
The separate modules for the Profile Macros plugin are listed as: 
{noformat} profile  	 
$module.name 	
follow 	
$module.name 	
$module.name {noformat}


The unnamed ones should indicate what they actually are, so that an administrator can choose whether to enable or disable them.
fields.summary: Plugin modules are unnamed for Profile Macros plugin

fields.description:
IE 8 was recently pushed out via the Windows Updater.  As such, some customers are now using it and would like Confluence to officially support it.  Here is a list of the currently supported browsers:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/_Supported+Browsers
fields.summary: Support Internet Explorer 8

fields.description:
When a Confluence installation has been set up to use SSL for all traffic (and has an appropriate Base URL set), "mixed content" warnings are still displayed when loading the "preview" tab while editing the page.

Using tools like Wireshark and Fiddler, we (myself and a customer) have repeatedly verified that no non-HTTPS traffic is being transmitted.

Steps to reproduce within Confluence:
# Using Internet Explorer 6.0 SP 3, log into an instance of Confluence that is secured.  Make sure you use either a hostname or IP address rather than localhost (which belongs to a different security zone).
# Edit a page, and then attempt to switch to the "Preview" tab.  A "mixed content" warning appears.

In my reading of the javascript files associated with the preview tab, I can see multiple instances in which the src attribute of an iframe is set to "javascript:void(0)", which seems to be the root of the problem.

Steps to reproduce the problem in it simplest form:

# Create a jsp file within your exploded war directory that contains the following source: {code:html}
<html>
<head>
    <title>Errors</title>
</head>
<body>
This is a test.

<iframe src="javascript:void(0)"/>
</body>
</html>
{code}
# Load the page from IE 6.  A "mixed content" warning is displayed.
fields.summary: "Mixed Content" warnings displayed when loading preview tab...

fields.description:
In order to get details about an existing SMTP Mailserver I clicked "Edit" in the dialog "View Mail Servers" in the admin section. 
In the following dialog "Edit SMTP Mail Server" the field "Password" is empty. I changed nothing and left the dialog by pressing the button "cancel".
Afterwards Confluence can not send mails anymore since the password of the mail server is missing ;)

The problem did not occure in Confluence 2.10.1 - the password field is not empty when watching / editing the Mail server configuration.
fields.summary: Viewing and Editing Mail Server Configuration removes password

fields.description:
The EAC attachments admin screen tells me that it is storing it's data on the filesystem, which is not true. It may "just" be a UI bug, but it could be more serious than that as well. With all the setting of the backup job going missing, could this be related, and part of a larger bug/problem?

Public signup, max attachment size, and all the other global settings were reverted to the defaults.
fields.summary: Global settings on EAC cluster were reverted to defaults on May 7
Add Support for case insensitive parameter values in the Macro Browser

fields.description:
We should use a more prominent color for headings. Please replace the light grey with a darker:

 #333

For labels in forms, we should de-emphasise them to give the forms more space to breathe. Please use the following styles there:

color: #666
font-weight: normal

This has been discussed with Stephen.
fields.summary: Use #333 for Headings in Confluence and #666 for labels
Use attachment filenames for HTML exports where possible

fields.description: I am unable to see the rich text editor using Internet Explorer 8.  Is this a known issue and is there a fix in the works?  If not, I guess I can go back to IE7.
fields.summary: Internet Explorer 8 Does not show Rich Text Editor
Notation guide gives the wrong default for the max parameter.
HTML macro duplicate tag BR when switching from wiki markup editor to RTE
Sort labels alphabetically for display

fields.description:
Hi,
we have a problem with Copy option from information tab after confluence migration (from version 2.5.2 to version 2.7.3).
When we copy a page with images in attachments, if the default editing mode is "Rich Text", after save all images are resized (32x32).
We use Tiny MCE Editor plugin version 2.11.

Before migration, with confluence 2.5.2, we use Tiny MCE Editor plugin version 2.2.

Regards,
Carturan
fields.summary: Copy page doesn't work if content of the source page contains images

fields.description:
When editing a particular page, on Extranet node 2 (https://node2.extranet.atlassian.com/display/RS/Lost+Opportunities+Detailed+Report) you frequently get the error -

{noformat}

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Post too large

        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFil
<snip>
{noformat}

This page is about 384K (so the posting will be about double that when you consider our hidden originalContent form field).

I tried to create a page on EAC, from the Confluence Home page. This is the URL:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=CONFDEV&fromPageId=69518087748059724

It produced a NPE. This  happened at 3:55 local Sydney time today. 8/MAY.  

Adnan tried the same on his box, same exception.  I tried it again, again same exception.
fields.summary: Creating a page throws NPE

fields.description:
Add an emoticon using the popup in the RTE.

Highlight the emoticon, and make it a link using the 'insert link' button.

The symbol is changed to the word (e.g. 'tick') and so the link will be saved as 
{noformat}[Tick|DOC:Network Overview]{noformat}

This renders as the text, not as the emoticon.  The user has to edit the wiki markup tab to get the desired behaviour.
fields.summary: Emoticons cannot be used as link alias in the RTE

fields.description: Viewfile macro does not show tab breaks in powerpoint files
fields.summary: Viewfile macro does not show tab breaks in powerpoint files

fields.description: Colour gradients in powerpoint files not displayed correctly using viewfile macro
fields.summary: Colour gradients in powerpoint files not displayed correctly using viewfile macro

fields.description:
This problem might not be specific to 3.0 but I've not had a chance to test on 2.10 yet.

If a page on Confluence has the unicode 0x14 character then any feed that tried to use the content of this page will cause the following to be logged:

{noformat}
<HTML page content snipped> is not legal for a JDOM character content: 0x14 is not a legal XML character.
javax.servlet.error.request_uri: /createrssfeed.action
os_authstatus: success
Parameters:
spaces : conf_all
publicFeed : false
title : Internal Blog RSS Feed
timeSpan : 5
rssType : atom
{noformat}

The page that did have the bad characters was - 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/RS/Lost+Opportunities+Detailed+Report
- although I've since removed the 0x14 character from that page.
fields.summary: Certain unicode characters in a page will break RSS feeds

fields.description:
REST plugins that provide web interfaces may want to be decorated using the <meta> decorator tags. In order for this to be followed, /rest needs to go through sitemesh, and needs to be excluded from the blanket /* decorator mapper.

The same behaviour has already been applied to JIRA - JRA-17182

See [commit in jira for details|https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/jira/jira/trunk/src/webapp/WEB-INF/decorators.xml?cs=79351]
fields.summary: Allow REST plugins to be decorated

Please Support Google App Engine/Java for Confluence & JIRA deployment

fields.description: if the viewfile filename contains two subsequent blanks / spaces like "file   name.xls"  the macro throws an error message.
fields.summary: viewfile error when filename contains two subsequent blanks / spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-15556].
  {panel}

We are trying to use Confluence, beside as regular wiki, also as communication channel to ask questions and discuss possible issues. Instead of having all project communication hidden inside private mail boxes, we want to have it "public" and archived on the related Confluence pages.

Problem is that the comment writer does not know if Confluence sends his online question out to the correct person. If the addressee is watching the page, it probably works fine, but if not, the writer needs to duplicate his message in a separate e-mail, or wait for a very long time till the addressee visits the page again.

This could be solved by:

1 - showing the current watchers when adding a comment
2 - allowing to enter extra users for sending notifications

The second point is also useful to pull related people into the discussion.
fields.summary: Allow to specify user list for notifications
Confluence doesn't support per-application module definition

fields.description:
Have just been experimenting with the new web-ui location introduced in 2.10.2 to add items to the dashboard.

If you don't specify an icon or a description for your web-ui item in this location, the icon or description text from the previous item will be displayed.
fields.summary: system.dashboard web-ui location doesn't clear icon or description text

fields.description:
Upload an image containing non-ASCII characters in the filename, and use the thumbnail on a page, e.g.:

{noformat}!awb överzicht.gif|thumbnail!{noformat}

Clicking on the thumbnail in IE will prompt to open/save the file.

The expected behaviour is to open the full-size image in a new window - this works correctly when using Firefox.

Note: this is logged against 3.0 as it is reporting the behaviour after the fix for CONF-14724.
fields.summary: IE prompts for download instead of opening thumbnail images containing non-ASCII characters

fields.description: Currently you can have macro aliases ie. web-widget is an alias for widget and both macros will open up the widget macro in the Macro Browser. However if for some reason the widget macro is disabled, the web-widget macro should still be usable via the Macro Browser but it currently isn't.
fields.summary: Macro aliases should work in the Macro Browser even if the macro itself is disabled

fields.description:
Atlassian-Bucket is a mish-mash of random classes that should be moved to proper places.

We can accelerate this process by moving the library inside Confluence so changing usages and fixing problems in this code is easier.
fields.summary: Remove dependency on atlassian-bucket

fields.description:
Example message:

{noformat}[atlassian.config.xml.AbstractDom4jXmlConfigurationPersister] saveDocumentAtomically Unable to move D:\confluence\data-2.10.2\confluence.cfg.xml9070676172658464167tmp to 
D:\confluence\data-2.10.2\confluence.cfg.xml. Falling back to non-atomic overwrite.{noformat}

Atomic file updates seem to be reasonably close to impossible on Windows. We should suppress this warning message (as it's not something the admin can do anything about). Ultimately, we should also fix CONF-8898 to make the update process safer, but that is not covered by this issue.
fields.summary: "Non-atomic" warning messages on Windows when updating confluence.cfg.xml
The i18n in velocity templates does not auto html encode parameters

fields.description: As mentioned in the related issue CONF-15539, extranet.atlassian.com's database contained two rows that were almost entirely null, including creation/modification date.  At least one of the pages has an attachment.  I added the dates in manually, but how these records came to exist is a mystery.  We should add not-null to the date columns to prevent this from happening again, but of course such constraints are difficult to add retrospectively.  The date on the attachment attached to [1717142914|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=1717142914&metadataLink=true] is Apr 02, 2009, so the bug may have been only in some early 3.0 milestone.
fields.summary: Content rows in database missing required data
